intro: Alaticaulia prosartema, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alaticaulia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
